primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The movement from the burden of past failures and the anxiety of passing time to a state of divine sustenance through the act of 'casting' burdens upon God.

tekstueel_bewijs: People of sane mind will feel a compulsion to reflect
We could have made the last year so much better
What shall we do at year's end?
We can cast our cares upon the Lord
releasing us from the burden of guilt
the psalmist's word ought to speak to us
the sentiment of a rejoicing singer in ancient Israel

ontvanger.identificatie: The Hearer (as the one who receives the 'second chance')
tekstueel_bewijs: he will give thee thy heart's desire
he shall never suffer the righteous to be moved
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Subject who must act (cast) to become the Receiver.

tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord will sustain those who put their faith in him
his faith in God speaks to the conditions
helper.rol_van_god: God is primarily a Helper who reacts to the Subject's initiative.
helper.rol_van_geest: Absent; replaced by 'a presence' or 'religious faith'.

tekstueel_bewijs: Time like an ever rolling stream
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is internal regret and the passage of time rather than radical evil or ontological sin.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical mandate to improve the lives of others and spread the gospel.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer
secundair_narratief_programma.object: The happiness of others / Spread of the kingdom
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon oscillates between God sustaining the hearer and the hearer's duty to 'make things better' without a clear causal link from grace to ethics.

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Lord can make our failures... turn out to his name's glory
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We could have made the last year so much better
we can cast our cares upon the Lord

voorbeelden: people... will feel a compulsion to reflect
we have not done what we should have done
We wish we could call the time back
we did not possess any sudden new knowledge
we have the power to make things a little better
our power to get the deal done

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'will' and 'desire' of the hearer to change their state through the 'decision of faith'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (Burden) to ~S2 (Repentance) to S1 (Sustenance).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is achieved by the human act of 'casting,' which triggers the divine response.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Moderate; S2 is treated as 'mistakes' and 'muffed chances' rather than death or judgment.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses the language of the Gospel, the actantial structure is anthropocentric: the human is the Subject who must 'cast' to activate God as the Helper.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: the Lord will sustain those who put their faith in him

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human as primary agent of change
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: we have the power to make things a little better

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: the way we have come was not our doing at all

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Psalmist is used as a model for the hearer's own 'loftiest decision of religious faith'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on how God preserved the Psalmist despite his desire to 'fly away'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to perform the 'act of faith' correctly to receive relief.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism where human initiative is the catalyst for grace.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from 'God's doing' in the past to 'our power' in the present creates a structural tension.
spanning_punten: The claim that the past was 'not our doing' vs the claim that we have 'the power to make things better'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: releasing us from the burden of guilt... and sending us forth strong

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The sermon assumes the hearer already has the 'power' (Pouvoir) to cast the burden.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Low; sin is described as 'muffed chances' and 'wrong turns'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon positions the hearer as the Subject of the verb 'to cast' and God as the Helper who 'sustains'. This makes grace a response to human action.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of the turning point.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make God the Subject who 'takes' the burden.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Cast your burden,' use 'Christ has come to take your burden upon Himself.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as the 'helpless one' in the Psalm.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the 'wit's end' state as the place where God acts unilaterally.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus on how the 'presence' actually gives the power that the hearer lacks.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Address the 'burden' as a terminal weight that no human can 'cast' by their own will.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'sustenance' of God a miracle rather than a psychological relief.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: 1. God sustains the failing sinner (Unconditional). 2. Therefore, the sinner is free to serve the neighbor.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a warm, pastoral tone, but its structural engine relies heavily on human resolve. Shifting the active verbs to God would transform this from a 'new year's resolution' into a proclamation of the Gospel.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is comforting; actantially, it is demanding.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the Hebrew context of Psalm 55; Greimas reveals the modern preacher's anthropocentric bias.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'faith' is being treated as a human 'work' or 'competence' (Savoir-faire) that triggers God's action.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses 'God' as a noun frequently, but 'Man' remains the primary driver of the narrative arc.
